to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: e-books and blind in UnitedStates of America
body:
True, and partially helpfull, can you give some examples of encryptian cracking 
software we can use?
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Jude DaShiell" 
To: 
Sent: Saturday, June 16, 2007 11:49 PM
Subject: re: e-books and blind in UnitedStates of America


> Blind citizens of the United States of America in the United States of
> America have been granted a D.M.C.A. exemption by the Librarian Of
> Congress which permits us to use whatever encryption cracking software we
> can use to crack the codes on D.M.C.A. protected e-books.  Security
> professionals are another class of people with this exemption provided
> they perform the cracking to test vulnerabilities in those systems.  Our
> exemption was granted to help us with access to the contents of those
> e-books.
>
>
> _______________________________________________
> Speakup mailing list
> Speakup@braille.uwo.ca
> http://speech.braille.uwo.ca/mailman/listinfo/speakup
>
